entries.meaning: A plot within a story, subsidiary to the main plot.
examples: Subplot, a story line enclosed within the principal story to provide relief from the main plot's tension, add character dimension, etc.

entries.meaning: A subdivision of a plot of land, especially one used for an agricultural experiment.
examples: [...] on sixteen 8/10-acre plots (12.8 acres) well distributed over the area. [...] A 1/160-acre subplot was established in a randomly chosen corner of each [...]

verbs.description: subplot (third-person singular simple present subplots, present participle subplotting, simple past and past participle subplotted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To provide (a story) with a subplot.
examples: In the pictures of places, too, an author uses economy; and for his plot, complicated and subplotted as it may seem, he cannot count on having vast stretches of eternity in which to elaborate forever.
